WRITING.TEXT:
I know how you feel. I've been binging after being binge free for almost a month.
It's just 1 set back, you didn't ruin all of your work. Any weight you gain isn't real weight, just food and water weight.
Don't beat yourself up too much

Hey there! I'm subject6210! I've been struggling with disordered eating on and off for about abut 7 years now. I'm currently in my worst relapse ever. I used to really struggle with purging but this time I mostly stick to restricting. I've been restricting to under 400 cals for over 2 months now.
I'm mostly likely going into recovery sometime in the new year. I'm excited and nervous. I want to stop living like this, but I have to reach my GW before I get admitted to the program.
I'm 19, I'm a university student studying biology. I want to be a doctor. My life is pretty boring, it's mostly been swallowed up by my eating disorder.

I wasn't restricting, I was mostly recovered back then. My hair is extremely thick and wavy. I didn't have any lanugo.
So I think once you hit your goal and start eating at maintenance, your hair will be nice and healthy.
It wasn't the greatest diet ever, but I ate pretty healthy.
When I was maintaining a bmi of around 15.5 I had super thick hair!
Thanks. I'm hoping that Christmas will boost my metabolism
My mom has, but no one else has.

*Height: 5'8

*GW: 84lbs
*UGW: as low as possible
*WL:-15lbs
*BMI: 13.39
*Age: 19
*Genderexpression: Female
I didn't lose any weight this week, unfortunately. Plus I'm probably going to gain so much because of the Christmas binge that's coming.
I just want someone to notice how sick I am. I want to look as sick on the outside as I am on the inside.
Yeah, I'm going to an ED clinic at my local hospital. I don't know if it'll be inpatient or intensive outpatient yet.
Glad to hear things are going well! I'm going into recovery in a few weeks, so I'm pretty nervous and scared, but I'm excited.

Lunch: 1/2 red bell pepper (11) celery (6) cucumber (8) and 2 egg whites (34)
Dinner: Rice cake with 1 and 1/2 tbsp of light peanut butter (155)
Snacks: Diet coke (0), vitamin water zero (0) and mio sport (0)
Total: 361 calories
That's what I keep telling myself. I actually wrote down a bunch of things to make me feel better about eating more for a few days

I'm increasing my intake a few days before Christmas. I'm hoping that it will reduce the chances of a binge and of getting sick because I ate too much. I really hope that it will boost my metabolism because I just hit a plateau, but I'm terrified that it will instead make me fat.

[This](http://imgur.com/a/YZlfx) is me from this week. I'm 3 lbs lighter than my last set of photos.
I didn't lose any weight this week, which makes me really sad

I had what I call the "death talk" with my psychiatrist yesterday. He explained to me that I am risking my life and I could die from complications. It was kind of scary.
Also, my sister just got in town for Christmas. We told her about my ed, and I'm worried about how she'll act around me. She's a psych student and I'm worried that she'll try to fix me.

WRITING.TITLE: Favorite zero calorie drinks?
WRITING.TEXT:
I was wondering what people's favorite zero calorie drinks were?
I like diet coke, tea, mio sport and water. But I'm looking for new ideas!
Oatmeal, egg whites, celery, red pepper, cucumbers, and rice cakes with light peanut butter. That is pretty much all I eat
I had the same thought! Haha
Thanks! It's really scary, I need all the bravery I can get
Thanks! I have a lot of support from my family which will be really helpful
Thanks! I'm terrified, but I know it's for the best

That's really well written! Hopefully you get the help and support you need.
Also, I don't think anyone here is really pro-ed, it's just a term for people who aren't ready to recover
I have tried it, but I'm really bad. I have a few things that help with anxiety
Thanks, I'm really scared, but I know I can't keep living like this. So I have to give recovery a shot
Thanks! I think I will hit my goal, only 5 lbs left, but Christmas will probably ruin my progress

WRITING.TITLE: Possibly going into treatment earlier than planned
WRITING.TEXT:
I was placed on a wait list for a treatment program at the end of November. During my phone interview they said that it would take 3-4 months for my assessment appointment and that I would probably start treatment in April or May. But since then I have lost quite a bit of weight and I have developed problems with my heart. I had to go to the ER last week because of low blood pressure/high heart rate.
I got a call yesterday that now my assessment appointment is at the beginning of January. I think it means that I will be going into treatment much sooner than planned/expected. This is making me really anxious. I really hope I can hit my goal weight before I go into treatment. This also means that I will most likely have to drop out of school next semester, which will suck a lot.
Urg, this has made me so much more anxious about everything. I really do want to recover, but knowing that it's coming faster than planned terrifies me.
I am an extremely picky eater, always have been. I rarely try new foods. Right now I'm only eating very few types of food

Breakfast: Oatmeal with brown sugar and cinnamon (147)
Lunch: 1/2 red bell pepper (11) celery (6) cucumber (8) and 2 egg whites (34)
Dinner: Rice cake with 1 and 1/2 tbsp of light peanut butter (155)
Snacks: Diet coke (0)
Total: 361 calories
I eat between 360 - 370 cals a day and my bmr is 1272 cals

I danced a lot, and people said I have the body of a ballet dance, but I have absolutely no coordination and I'm super clumsy, so I just looked really awkward, not graceful. I had to stop because of an injury a few years ago.
I went to high school with the ballet dancers who trained in the professional program at the local ballet academy. They were so tall and thin and triggered me everyday.

I noticed my weightloss in my stomach and thighs because that's where most of my fat is. I've always had a thigh gap and visible collar bones. My chest bones are just starting to peak out at a bmi of 13.39.
So beautiful! I used to want to be a ballerina so badly as a kid, I still do actually. I just never was a great dancer haha.
